This script was adapted and edited from both Hollie Putnam and Danielle Becker's P&R script. This edited script incorperates run and sample metadata, P&R files and the surface area

#Week 1 of PR- July 08 -July 09 2024

## Set working directory and get the file path
```{r, warning = FALSE}

setwd("C:/Users/flo_f/OneDrive - University of Rhode Island/GitHub/Coral_Priming_Experiments_Summer_2024/data/physiology/PR_use")

path.p<-"20240708_09"

getwd()
```

### Import data files
```{r, warning = FALSE}
#list all csv file names
file.names<-basename(list.files(path = path.p, pattern = "csv$", recursive = TRUE))
# omit metadata from files to be read in as data
file.names <- file.names[!grepl("metadata", file.names)]   

# Load Surface area
SA <- read.csv(file="C:/Users/flo_f/OneDrive - University of Rhode Island/GitHub/Coral_Priming_Experiments_Summer_2024/output/physiology/Surface_Area/Surface_Area.csv", header=T)

# Load sample metadata
Sample.Info <- read.csv(file="20240708_09/pr_sample_metadata.csv", header=T) #read in sample.info data

# Load run metadata
run.info <- read_csv(file = "20240708_09/pr_run_metadata.csv")
```

##Formating dataset for script
```{r, warning = FALSE}
# Join run and sample metadta first by sample id

colnames(SA)[colnames(SA) == "Colony_id"] <- "sample.id" #changing the column name in SA to match the sample metadata column name
metadata <- full_join(Sample.Info, run.info)%>%
  mutate(Date = as_date(as.character(Date), format = "%Y%m%d", tz = ""))


# Select only certain columnns
metadata <- metadata %>%
  select(sample.id, Run, Treatment, Species, Chamber.Vol.L, Date, Start.time, Stop.time, Light_Percent, Temp.Cat)

# Read in all data files
#edit sample.id name to remove .csv and the date from files
df <- tibble(file.name = file.names) %>%
  mutate(sample.id = gsub("_.*", "", file.name))%>%  # Get sample from filename and select for info before the first _
  mutate(sample.id = gsub(".csv", "", sample.id),  #remove .csv from sample.id
          info = map(sample.id, ~filter(metadata, sample.id == .)),           # Get associated sample info
         data0 = map(file.name, ~read_csv(file.path(path.p, .), skip = 1, col_types = cols(.default = "d", Time = "t"))))   # Get associated O2 data

# Select only Time, Value, and Temp columns from O2 data
df <- df %>%
  mutate(data0 = map(data0, ~select(., Time, Value, Temp)))%>%
  mutate(data0 = map(data0, ~(.x %>% filter(complete.cases(.))))) #remove NAs 

```

## Use the time breaks in the sample info to link O2 data with light levels
```{r, warning = FALSE}
df <- df %>%
  mutate(intervals = map2(data0, info, function(.x, .y) {
    split(.x, f = cut(as.numeric(.x$Time), breaks = as.numeric(c(.y$Start.time, last(.y$Stop.time))),
                      labels = as.character(.y$Light_Percent)))})) %>%
  mutate(data = map(intervals, ~ unnest(tibble(.), .id = "Light_Percent")))

## 'data' now contains the O2 data with the corresponding light level as another column
## Example of what 'data' for each sample looks like:
# df$data[[1]]

```


## Thin data
```{r, fig.height = 8, fig.width = 8}
# Set thinning parameter
thin_par <- 20

# Thin data for all samples
df <- df %>%
  mutate(thin_data = map(data, ~ slice(., seq(1, nrow(.), thin_par))))


# Create plots for full dataset and thinned data
df <- df %>%
  mutate(data_plot = map2(data, sample.id, ~ ggplot(.x, aes(x = Time, y = Value)) + 
                            facet_wrap(~ as.numeric(Light_Percent), scales = "free") +
                            geom_point() +
                            labs(title = .y)),
    thin_data_plot = map2(thin_data, sample.id, ~ ggplot(.x, aes(x = Time, y = Value)) + 
                            facet_wrap(~ as.numeric(Light_Percent), scales = "free") +
                            geom_point() +
                            labs(title = .y)))

# Example of plots
cowplot::plot_grid(df$data_plot[[1]], df$thin_data_plot[[1]], nrow = 2,
                   labels = c("Example plot: all data", "Example plot: thinned data"))



```

## The full or thinned data plot for any sample can be accessed like this:
```{r, warning = FALSE}
df %>%
  filter(sample.id == "DL-1-11") %>%
  pull(thin_data_plot)
```

# Fit regressions to each interval for each sample
```{r, warning = FALSE}
# Define function for fitting LoLinR regressions to be applied to all intervals for all samples
fit_reg <- function(df) {
  rankLocReg(xall = as.numeric(df$Time), yall = df$Value, 
             alpha = 0.2, method = "pc", verbose = FALSE)
}

# Setup for parallel processing
plan(multisession)

# Map LoLinR function onto all intervals of each sample's thinned dataset
df <- df %>%
  mutate(regs = furrr::future_map(thin_data, function(.) {       # future_map executes function in parallel
    group_by(., Light_Percent) %>%
    do(rankLcRg = fit_reg(.))
  }))

## Now 'regs' contains the fitted local regressions for each interval of each sample's thinned dataset

# Define function to pull out and plot regression diagnostics
plot_rankLcRg <- function(sample.id, interval_number) {
  df %>%
    filter(sample.id == sample.id) %>%
    pluck("regs", 1, "rankLcRg", interval_number) %>%
    plot()
}
```
## Extract slope of best regression for each interval for each sample
```{r}
df.out <- df %>% 
  unnest(regs) %>%
  mutate(micromol.L.s = map_dbl(rankLcRg, ~ pluck(., "allRegs", "b1", 1)))
```

## Adjust by chamber volume and normalize to surface area
```{r}
### Merge rates with sample info
pr <- left_join(
  select(df.out, sample.id, Light_Percent, micromol.L.s),
  distinct(metadata, sample.id, Treatment, Run, Chamber.Vol.L, Date)
)

## Correct for chamber volume and blanks
pr <- pr %>%
  mutate(micromol.s = micromol.L.s * Chamber.Vol.L)

# Get blank values -- average for each run and light value in case multiple blanks
blanks <- pr %>%
  filter(grepl("BLANK", sample.id)) %>%
  group_by(Run, Light_Percent) %>%
  summarise(micromol.s.blank = mean(micromol.s))

# Join blank values with rest of data and subtract values from samples for same run and light value
pr <- left_join(pr, blanks) %>%
  mutate(micromol.s.adj = micromol.s - micromol.s.blank) %>%
  # After correcting for blank values, remove blanks from data
  filter(!grepl("BLANK", sample.id))

# Join surface area with rest of data
pr <- left_join(pr, select(SA, sample.id, surface.area.cm2))

# Normalize rates by surface area
pr <- pr %>%
  mutate(micromol.cm2.s = micromol.s.adj / surface.area.cm2,
         micromol.cm2.h = micromol.cm2.s * 3600)

Photo <- pr %>%
  filter(Light_Percent ==331)%>% 
  separate(sample.id, c("Species","Genotype","Rep"), sep = "-", remove=FALSE)

Resp <- pr %>%
  filter(Light_Percent ==0)%>% 
  separate(sample.id, c("Species","Genotype","Rep"), sep = "-", remove=FALSE)

Photo <- na.omit(Photo) %>% select("sample.id", micromol.cm2.h, Treatment, Genotype, Species)
#colnames(Photo)[1] <- "sample.id"
Photo$Timepoint <- "Week5"
Photo$measure <- "Photo"
Resp <- na.omit(Resp) %>% select("sample.id", micromol.cm2.h, Treatment, Genotype, Species)
#colnames(Resp)[1] <- "sample.id"
Resp$Timepoint <- "Week5"
Resp$measure <- "Resp"

write.csv(Photo, file="C:/Users/flo_f/OneDrive - University of Rhode Island/GitHub/Coral_Priming_Experiments_Summer_2024/output/physiology/PR/Photo_Rawextracted_rates_Week5.csv")
write.csv(Resp, file="C:/Users/flo_f/OneDrive - University of Rhode Island/GitHub/Coral_Priming_Experiments_Summer_2024/output/physiology/PR/Resp_Rawextracted_rates_Week5.csv")
```
